hacks.title: Structure the Problem First
hacks.tip: Before prompting, list the sub-steps you want the AI to follow. It keeps you in control of the logic.
hacks.example: “Break the launch plan into research, messaging, and test steps before suggesting copy.”

hacks.title: Ask for Receipts
hacks.tip: When a response feels confident, ask the AI to cite why it thinks it’s correct. You’ll catch weak spots faster.
hacks.example: “List three supporting facts you used to reach this conclusion.”

hacks.title: Remix the Perspective
hacks.tip: Invite the model to answer from opposing viewpoints. It keeps you adaptable when your first direction stalls.
hacks.example: “How would a product manager and a customer success lead tackle this?”

hacks.title: Pair AI with Human QA
hacks.tip: Let the AI ship a first draft, then quickly audit the clarity and tone yourself. You gain speed without over-relying.
hacks.example: “Draft the email, then highlight any phrasing that could sound overly formal.”

hacks.title: Spot-Check with a Second Source
hacks.tip: When accuracy matters, ask the AI where it could be wrong and what you should verify manually.
hacks.example: “Where might this analysis be off, and what should I double-check?”
